question.text: Which of the following statement is incorrect about photosynthesis?

options.text: Increase in incident light beyond a point increases formation of chlorophyll and thus increase in photosynthesis.
At high light intensities, both C<sub>3</sub> and C<sub>4</sub> plants show increase in the rates of photosynthesis.

C<sub>3</sub> plants respond to higher CO<sub>2</sub> concentration by showing increased rates of photosynthesis leading to higher productivity has been used for some greenhouse crops such as tomatoes and bell pepper.
Tropical plants have a higher temperature optimum than the plants adapted to temperate climates.

solution.text: There is a linear relationship between incident light and CO<sub>2</sub> fixation rates at low light intensities. At higher light intensities, gradually the rate does not show further increase as other factors become limiting. Increase in incident light beyond a point causes the breakdown of chlorophyll and a decrease in photosynthesis.
